data.name: XTreeNode
desc: An instance implementing this interface represents the model data for an entry in a XTreeDataModel.
The TreeControl uses this interface to retrieve the model information needed to display a hierarchical outline
Each XTreeNode in a XTreeDataModel must be unique.

methods.name: getChildAt
desc: Returns the child tree node at Index.

methods.name: getChildCount
desc: Returns the number of child nodes.

methods.name: getCollapsedGraphicURL
desc: The URL for a graphic that is rendered to visualize collapsed non leaf nodes.
If URL is empty, XTreeControl.DefaultCollapsedGraphicURL is used.

methods.name: getDisplayValue
desc: If not empty, the textual representation of this any is used as the text part of this node.

methods.name: getExpandedGraphicURL
desc: The URL for a graphic that is rendered to visualize expanded non leaf nodes.
If URL is empty, XTreeControl.DefaultExpandedGraphicURL is used.

methods.name: getIndex
desc: Returns the index of Node in this instances children.

methods.name: getNodeGraphicURL
desc: The URL for a graphic that is rendered before the text part of this node.
If this URL is empty, no graphic is rendered.

methods.name: getParent
desc: Returns the parent node of this node.

methods.name: hasChildrenOnDemand
desc: Returns TRUE if the children of this node are created on demand.
A TreeControl will handle a node that returns TRUE always like a node that has child nodes, even if getChildCount() returns 0.
